entry.title: Relative CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY (was CLTV proposal)
entry.summary: The conversation seems to be related to the design and implementation of op_maturity. One individual suggests upgrading it to absolute cltv, and taking the current height as a parameter to verifyScript, while another suggests using a soft-fork to implement CLTV as is. They also discuss the potential issues and compromises that come with implementing RCLTV and the need to make sure the new nVersion soft-fork mechanism works. Overall, the conversation seems to revolve around finding the best way to implement and upgrade these features while minimizing risks and maximizing benefits.
